title: How Bill Maher And Jon Stewart Can Swing Elections
teaser: How much of an impact do these comedians have on politics? NPR TV critic Eric Deggans joins us to discuss "alternative" election coverage.
contentencoded:
As you think about voting tomorrow, where will you go for information about the candidates and the issues? If you’re of a certain age group and political persuasion, you’re likely watching programs like “The Daily Show” with Jon Stewart and “Real Time with Bill Maher.”

Those programs do offer a lot of information about the elections, but the debate always centers on this: if it’s entertainment, can it also be real journalism? NPR TV critic Eric Deggans joins Here & Now‘s Robin Young to talk more about this “alternative” election coverage.

  • See more segments with TV critic Eric Deggans

Guest

  • Eric Deggans, TV critic for NPR. He tweets @Deggans.
